intro: Schismatoglottis fossae, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a tropical plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Schismatoglottis fossae is often found growing in shaded, humid environments such as mountain forests. Its botanical characteristics make it a unique and sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts.
